creator: m.thomas@valueclick.com
text:
Version listed as 2.2.0 but I imagine this effects 1.3 - 2.3. Platform and OS are likely to be All and are set as such.

Office 2007 documents (eg docx, xlsx) are being detected as ZIP files. This is not so much a bug as a tweak to work with Microsoft's new method of delivering files.

Office 2007 Docs are indeed .Zip files with alternate file extensions. If possible the mime_magic detect for zip (gzip) files should be changed to look at the ext on the file and provide an alternate mapping in the case of Microsoft office documents.

It is the nature of mod_mime_magic that it cannot discriminate
between media types that overlap in data format.  That is why
most Apache sites do not use mod_mime_magic.

I suggest retrieving the most recent version of mime.types from

http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/httpd/httpd/trunk/docs/conf/mime.types

and using that instead.
creator: fielding@apache.org
